title: Introducing: We Cut Corners
body: Having just returned from the fantastic [**Hard Working Class Heroes Festival**](http://hwch.net/) in Dublin which took place over the past few days, I’m now knuckling down and searching out some of the brilliant acts I saw over the course of the event. After spending several hours in hospital on Thursday night (more on that later) I hopped in a taxi and headed straight to the Button Factory, just in time for [**We Cut Corners**](http://www.facebook.com/wecutcorners), a pop-punk duo comprised of two Dublin based school teachers. Sounds bizarre, I know. For my first real experience of the Irish music scene, it couldn’t have started much better. The performance was tight and vividly engaging; swinging between riff-heavy, almost grunge inspired anthems, to delicate, vocal driven acoustic numbers. It always impresses me when a two-piece can create such a stunning wall of sound, a trait that Brighton duo Blood Red Shoes pull off expertly, and **We Cut Corners** succeeded in maintaining with an air of elegance. It speaks volumes that I remember **We Cut Corners** playing _The Leopard_, a stomping two minute frenzy of strained vocals and jagged guitars. For a band whose music I hadn’t previously been exposed to, they left a memorably positive impression, with what was quite comfortably one of the most self-assured, wholesome performances I’ve seen in a while. Grab a free download of _The Leopard_ below. The Leopard by we cut corners
